values: "Ye could have been more careful, me lord." "Careful?" "Naught lettin' that bully try and kill ye!" "...it was a drill." "Oh, aye. That's why yer getting blood all over me nice clean steps, yes? Because it's a drill." Sulwyn is quiet and nice but she does have, underneath that mild-mannered and pretty exterior, a will of solid iron and a temper. Currently, Melehan is getting the effects of the later. Not that he minds, really. So he sits there on the freshly-scrubbed step in the courtyard, and lets his girlfriend mutter as she bandages his arm.

Dinner had been an...interesting affair. The important discussion and symbolism having taken place, Bedivere and his son could afford to relax into the warmth that they normally got from Maelgwn's court. That, at least, had been normal, but all there had noted on Mordred's sons not talking to each other. Sulwyn, gathering the things afterwards, had the grace to look slightly embrassed when she caught Melou's eye even as she smiled at the silent Melehan.

Melehan, however, escaped the hall as soon as he could. Taking the steps two at time, he skidded into his room and shut the door. The idea that had come to him while talking to Ramon had been resting in his mind now for most of the day. Still, the details eluded him and he needed his brother.

His brother, to whom he was arguing. Or, at least, not talking to.

Kicking the wall, the boy crawls on the bed and settles himself against the wall. Making sure he could hear not footsteps outside, he brings out a book and starts to read.

Spring has sprung, the grass has riz, I wonder where the prince is? Up a tree, as it turns out. And Spring hasn't exactly come, seeing as it's...February. But the lanky, fourteen-year-old heir to the High Kingship is in a tree. Reading. Or, as his brother would put it, hiding. Whatever.

Melou *Totally makes plans to hit on Spoiler!Steph when he's 17* Melehan: *raises eyebrow, rolls eyes* Melou: She's a SUPERHERO Melehan:...and? Melehan: She also has nice tits. So, which are you more interested in? Melou: Probably pretty flexible Melehan: You just keep dreaming, little brother Melou: That's what I do Melehan: Then dream IN PRIVATE MElou: Hey, you brought up her tits Melehan: *beat* I was being pre-emptive Melou: Uh huh. You know, if you got your nose out of books and starting talking to girls, you wouldn't be soo cranky all the time. Melehan: Excuse me? Melou: *grins* Melehan: *DISDAINS TO EVEN ANSWER THAT* Melou: I'll even help. You start simple, with, like "Hi." Melehan: *puts book down, very carefully, grabs an apple and throws it at Melou's head* Melou: *knew that was coming* *catches, takes a bite* Melehan: Oh, piss off. Melou: *grins again* *ruffles Mele's hair* Melehan: *grabs book and IGNORES* lamorgne:*grins* They? Will be FUN Cywyll: heeeeeee lamorgne: *bounces* Cywyll: *does too!* Cywyll: but tiredly lamorgne: of course, now I can see Melou trying to set Mele up with people and it's cracking me up Cywyll: well, only after he's decided he doesn't want them himself >.> lamorgne: ahahah Melou: Come on, ladies! He's the future King of Briton! Can't do much better than that! Melehan: HIGH King, twit. *is probably sekritly gay or something* lamorgne: but that note, we shall see. He's just smirking at me and not telling me a damn thing Melou: EXACTLY. That means you have to have kids and stuff Melehan: *turns red* I'm sure, I'll, um. Manage Melou: *shakes head sadly* You're hopeless Melehan:....I have YOU around! Why do I have to have the heirs? Melou: Because YOU'RE going to be the High King. I'm just your dashingly handsome younger brother. Melehan: Dashingly handsome? We're IDENTICAL! Melou: *waves hand* Irrelevant. Melehan: Melou. I'm trying to READ Melou: And I'm trying to distract you. I think I'm winning. Melehan: *silently fumes* Melou: *beams*

Father. Morgan's son, she left him at the Orkneys with her sister when he was 7. Morgause dotes on him, the only mother-figure he really knew. Uncle Maelgwn, married to Nesta. Has three children, Rhun, three years younger than the twins, Bridei, and a sister Eurgain (who seems to be the only legitimate child. Rhun gets the throne. Mother: Calls Melehan 'anwylyd' = dear, darling - another form of cariad, which is Melou's name. Magic: Have to use spells, though Mordred could have dreams and visions. The twins in herited it - Melou dreams, Melehan waking visions? Religion: Pagan Books: Virigil Icons: By Steph, for when they are 17 1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6.
